title: Modernize typography on the public main page

requirements.summary: Load and apply a modern sans-serif font globally so route '/' typography updates consistently across headings, body text, buttons, and navigation in light/dark mode.
acceptanceCriteria: A modern font is loaded in the app (via `frontend/index.html` and/or CSS) and applied through Tailwind (e.g., by configuring `fontFamily.sans` in `frontend/tailwind.config.js`).

The global base styles apply the new font to the `body` (in `frontend/src/index.css`) so text on the main page (`frontend/src/pages/PublicOverviewPage.tsx`) renders in the new font without requiring per-component overrides.
Key main page typography (e.g., the H1 'ROTAS E DIREITOS' and supporting paragraph) visually reflects the new modern font when previewed in the browser.
No changes are made to any immutable paths under `frontend/src/components/ui` or authentication hooks listed as immutable.

file_operations.description: Load a modern sans-serif webfont (e.g., via a hosted stylesheet link with preconnect for performance) so it is available app-wide before React renders.
Configure Tailwind typography to use the newly loaded modern font as the default sans font stack (set `theme.extend.fontFamily.sans` to the new font with sensible fallbacks).
Apply the new sans font globally by setting the base `body` to use Tailwind's `font-sans` (or equivalent base layer rule) while preserving existing light/dark readability styles.
